html:
Lord shall whistle. The Lord will signal or prompt the Assyrian armies (here referred to as "bees") to come down on Judah. The Lord shall whistle to the bees is a symbol built on an actual ancient practice, for Cyrillus of Alexandria (ca. a.d. 400) wrote about beekeepers who whistled to bees to get them to return to their hives.

fly/bee. These refer to fighting soldiers (see Deut. 1:44; Ps. 118:12). These symbols are well chosen, for "the flooding of the Nile brought…swarms of flies…. The hill districts of Assyria were well known for their bees."

rivers of Egypt/land of Assyria. Assyria's domination and power would reach as far south as the rivers of Egypt, and Assyria would even rule Egypt for a brief period during the following century.
